purpose: Highlight pitfalls and best practices in designing compensation plans.
title: Pitfalls to be aware of when designing compensation plans

tables.title: Pitfalls and Best Practices
tables.description: Comparison of potential pitfalls and best practice principals.

cells: Use of proxy metrics not well correlated with TSR such as EPS growth, revenue growth
Incorporate TSR/iTSR as metric and target setting device in incentive system
Lack of reward for well thought through investing for long term success
Ensure long term results strongly incorporated into incentives & intelligent investing for the future is encouraged
Executives rewarded for short term performance even if it creates risks to business long term
Use holistic measures such a iTSR balanced with long term horizons
Internal stretch may not equal external expectations
Use TSR benchmarks along with portfolio roles & business potential to set external expectations & performance targets
Employees either coasting or giving up because targets are too low or too high
Set targets based on an appropriate TSR success goals, business roles and potential
Compensation metrics not transparent and/or based on too many variables to be sufficiently understood or managed
Identify minimum number of high priority metrics(e.g. iTSR) that are linked and transparent to executives
Inconsistent application of incentives, frequent expectations, little respect for rules
Design and stick with a system, enforce equally throughout, modify rarely
